org.vertx.java.core

Interface Vertx


  • public interface Vertx
    A singleton instance of Vertx is available to all verticles.

    It contains operations to set and cancel timers, and deploy and undeploy verticles, amongst other things.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setTimer

        long setTimer(long delay,
            Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
        Set a one-shot timer to fire after delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the timer

      • setPeriodic

        long setPeriodic(long delay,
               Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
        Set a periodic timer to fire every delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the timer

      • cancelTimer

        boolean cancelTimer(long id)
        Cancel the timer with the specified id. Returns true if the timer was successfully cancelled, or false if the timer does not exist.

      • nextTick

        void nextTick(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
        Call the specified event handler asynchronously on the next "tick" of the event loop.

      • isEventLoop

        boolean isEventLoop()
        Is the current thread an event loop thread?
        Returns:
        true if current thread is an event loop thread

                                    int instances)
        Deploy a worker verticle programmatically
        Parameters:
        main - The main of the verticle
        instances - The number of instances to deploy (defaults to 1)
        Returns:
        Unique deployment id

        Parameters:

        config - JSON config to provide to the verticle
        instances - The number of instances to deploy (defaults to 1)

        Unique deployment id
